data.title: Why is Edmonton considered Northern Alberta when it’s 150 miles closer to Montana than NWT?
data.meta_description:
Answer (1 of 10): It isn’t. It is central Alberta. In detailed maps, Alberta is generally split into southern, central and northern Alberta. The border between central and northern is just north of Grande Cache, Whitecourt, and Cold Lake Alberta.
